repnme.cdata!: Lao PDR - Catalytic Fund EFA/FTI Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The Catalytic Fund EFA/FTI Program for
            Lao PDR received a moderately satisfactory outcome rating
            with moderate risk to development outcome. The Bank received
            a moderately satisfactory performance rating while the
            Borrowers performance was rated satisfactory. There were
            two restructurings that took place during this project. The
            first restructuring moved a school feeding program into
            community grants disbursement category; added six districts
            to the program and reallocated funds. The second
            restructuring replaced the wording school feeding with
            school meals; extend closing date; modified the results
            framework and adjusted indicator targets; and reallocated
            funds. The following lessons were learned from this project:
            (1) Decentralization of school construction to remote rural
            communities increases ownership and commitment to education.
            (2) Mainstreaming implementation within government agencies
            requires ongoing capacity building. (3)
            Well-defined/well-targeted pilot activities can have a large
            impact when providing governments with tangible evidence.
            (4) Inclusion of analytical studies as part of project
            design is essential for providing guidance to decision
            makers on systemic reforms. (5) Strong financial management
            systems are critical for ensuring the efficient use and
            accounting of resources.

repnme.cdata!:
Lao People's Democratic Republic -
            Education for All-Fast Track Initiative (EFA-FTI) Catalytic
            Fund Application Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Education for
            All-Fast Track Initiative (EFA-FTI) Catalytic Fund
            Application Project is to 'support the Government of
            Lao People's Democratic Republic (GOL) to increase the
            coverage and improve the quality of pre-primary and primary
            education with a focus on the most educationally
            disadvantaged children' remains the same. The changes
            will include: (i) replacing the reference to 'school
            feeding' with 'school meal program' in
            schedule one of the grant agreement to reflect the
            Government's new name for the program; (ii) extending
            the program closing date from August 31, 2013 to August 31,
            2014 for both trust funds in order to complete all program
            activities, particularly the new and innovative school meal
            and the non-formal education programs; (iii) modifying
            selected results framework indicators to ensure realistic
            targets to be met by the revised program closing date; (iv)
            reducing the number of schools constructed from the overly
            ambitious original target of 1,500 to 412 based on a
            detailed analysis of the district's needs; (v)
            narrowing the scope of the monitoring and evaluation
            component to focus on pre-primary and primary sub-sectors
            which are directly related to the project interventions; and
            (vi) reallocating grant proceeds among the disbursement
            categories for both trust funds.
